comment: Lab environment wasn't available for a looong time. The first 2-3 "labs" were complicated for a lot to set up. Weekly quizzes (unlimited attempts, score is based on average of attempts), gave two attempts for the Cyberbit labs and 3 exams. Pretty straightforward class besides the rocky start.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Great at communication and available on teams, however the lab environment did not become available until nearly 2 months into the semester. Still required to complete all previous labs in a specified amount of time... Test heavy. 60% of your grade is reliant on Tests. Good luck.

cybersecurity/isa professors make sure to let you know that you are just an afterthought and this job is their side gig. Not really a review of Mr. Wilder, as he himself was helpful (after his main gig of course). The cyber department is filled with a bunch of part time "Don't bother me" professors.

Prof. is one of these 'gig/side-hustle' professors. The class is an afterthought. Very disorganized, zero insight into what you do wrong on labs, etc. Total confusion and chaos throughout the semester. The lab portion of the course didn't even become fully functional until over a month into the semester. Still not even sure what he was there for?
Teacher does not teach but asks TA to do everything. One of the most hands off teachers ive ever seen.

Doesn't teach at all. Relies on Andy Green to answer student questions (Green is not proficient enough to teach either). Wilder left us in the dark saying he could not answer any questions. Uses an old presentation template. No professionalism and organization with the documents provided. One time says he needs to take his meds and went to bed.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He doesn't care to teach his own class, he prefers Dr. Andy Green to do so and just check out his bad reviews.... You will get stonewalled if you tell him that Dr. Green is not helpful and you would prefer his help. God help this entire department....

A diamond in the rough. This man wants the best for his students and genuinely wants to offer every opportunity to succeed, you just have to be smart enough to take them. He's out there almost every night on Microsoft Teams just waiting to answer questions and meet with students, take him if you want to get the most out of a class.

Took him for CYBR 4200. The class was fine at first, but the final exam had 20 questions and only 12 minutes to take it, and he refused to give us more time. Several of my classmates ran out of time and those that didn't only had seconds to spare. Beware. Also, the tests have 2 parts and 1 is a time consuming written portion. Tests are open book.

He genuinely cares for his students and is always willing to help when he can, I am not a ISA major but a IS major and if you are in my shoes don't take this class it is pretty difficult, how ever if you are a ISA major I would recommend him he is always willing to help out. the course is Linux heavy which I have not used before.
